tool.name: plink
tool.command:
## Create Plink folder for any inputs mkdir ./plink_output && mkdir ./plink_input
## If bmerge is set, create folder for merged files #if $functions.func == 'data_manage': #if $functions.bmerge.set == 'Yes': && mkdir bmerge_files && ln -s '$functions.bmerge.bed.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.bed' 'bmerge_files/bmerge_input.bed' && ln -s '$functions.bmerge.bed.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.bim' 'bmerge_files/bmerge_input.bim' && ln -s '$functions.bmerge.bed.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.fam' 'bmerge_files/bmerge_input.fam' #end if #end if
#if $inputs.inputs.filetype == 'bfile': && ln -s '$inputs.inputs.bed.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.bed' 'plink_input/plink_input.bed' && ln -s '$inputs.inputs.bed.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.bim' 'plink_input/plink_input.bim' && ln -s '$inputs.inputs.bed.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.fam' 'plink_input/plink_input.fam' && plink --bfile plink_input/plink_input #elif $inputs.inputs.filetype == 'vcf': #if $inputs.inputs.input.is_of_type('bcf'): && plink --bcf '$inputs.inputs.input' #else: && plink --vcf '$inputs.inputs.input' #end if #end if
## Plink commands by section #if $inputs.covar_input: --covar '$inputs.covar_input' #end if #if $inputs.set_pheno.set_pheno == 'Yes': --pheno $inputs.set_pheno.pheno $inputs.set_pheno.all_pheno #end if #if $functions.func == 'filtering': ##ID list functions #if $functions.id_list.func == 'keep': --keep '$functions.id_list.file' #elif $functions.id_list.func == 'keep-fam': --keep-fam '$functions.id_list.file' #elif $functions.id_list.func == 'remove': --remove '$functions.id_list.file' #elif $functions.id_list.func == 'remove-fam': --remove-fam '$functions.id_list.file' #end if
##Extraction #if $functions.extraction.ex_func == 'extract': --extract $functions.extraction.range $functions.extraction.file #elif $functions.extraction.ex_func == 'exclude': --exclude $functions.extraction.range $functions.extraction.file #end if
##Chromosome-specificity #if $functions.chromosome: --chr $functions.chromosome #end if
#if $functions.excluded_chromosome: --not-chr $functions.excluded_chromosome #end if
$functions.extra_chromosomes
#if $functions.autosome != 'none' $functions.autosome #end if
##SNP specificity #if $functions.snps_exclusives != 'No': --snps-only #if $functions.snps_exclusives == 'acgt': 'just-acgt' #end if #end if
##Variant windows #if $functions.ranges.single_multi == 'single': #if $functions.ranges.window.type == 'variant': #if $functions.ranges.window.from: --from $functions.ranges.window.from #end if #if $functions.ranges.window.to: --to $functions.ranges.window.to #end if #elif $functions.ranges.window.type == 'window': #if $functions.ranges.window.snp: --snp $functions.ranges.window.snp #end if #if $functions.ranges.window.exclude_snp: --exclude-snp $functions.ranges.window.exclude_snp #end if #if $functions.ranges.window.window: --window $functions.ranges.window.window #end if #else: #if $functions.ranges.window.from_bp: --from-bp $functions.ranges.window.from_bp #end if #if $functions.ranges.window.to_bp: --to-bp $functions.ranges.window.to_bp #end if #end if #elif $functions.ranges.single_multi == 'multi': $functions.ranges.force_intersect #if $functions.ranges.snps: --snps $functions.ranges.snps #end if #if $functions.ranges.exclude_snps: --exclude-snps $functions.ranges.exclude_snps #end if #end if
##Thinning #if $functions.thinning.thinning == 'Yes': #if $functions.thinning.thin: --thin $functions.thinning.thin #end if #if $functions.thinning.thin_count: --thin-count $functions.thinning.thin_count #end if #if $functions.thinning.bp_space: --bp-space $functions.thinning.bp_space #end if #if $functions.thinning.thin_indiv: --thin-indiv $functions.thinning.thin_indiv #end if #if $functions.thinning.thin_indiv_count: --thin-indiv-count $functions.thinning.thin_indiv_count #end if #end if
##Pheno/covariate ###########
###########
##Missing genotype rates #if $functions.geno_rates.geno: --geno $functions.geno_rates.geno #end if #if $functions.geno_rates.mind: --mind $functions.geno_rates.mind #end if
##Allele Frequencies #if $functions.allele_freq.maf: --maf $functions.allele_freq.maf #end if #if $functions.allele_freq.max_maf: --max-maf $functions.allele_freq.max_maf #end if #if $functions.allele_freq.mac: --mac $functions.allele_freq.mac #end if #if $functions.allele_freq.max_mac: --max-mac $functions.allele_freq.max_mac #end if
## Hardy-Weinberg #if $functions.hwe.hwe == 'Yes': --hwe $functions.hwe.hwe_val #for $type in $functions.hwe.modifiers: $type #end for #end if
##Sex and Founder filter #if $functions.sex_founder_filter.filter == 'Yes' $functions.sex_founder_filter.sex_select #if $functions.sex_founder_filter.no_sex_select: $functions.sex_founder_filter.no_sex_select #end if $functions.sex_founder_filter.nonfounders #end if
#elif $functions.func == 'data_manage': #if $functions.bmerge.set == 'Yes': --bmerge bmerge_files/bmerge_input #end if
#if $functions.template: --set-missing-var-ids $functions.template #end if
$functions.recode
#if $functions.flip: --flip $functions.flip #end if
#if $functions.length: --new-id-max-allele-len $functions.length #end if
#if $functions.update_cols.set == 'update_map': --update-map $functions.update_cols.input $functions.update_cols.col_num $functions.update_cols.old_col $functions.update_cols.skip #elif $functions.update_cols.set == 'update_name': --update-name $functions.update_cols.input $functions.update_cols.col_num $functions.update_cols.var_col $functions.update_cols.skip #end if #if $functions.ref_allele.set == 'yes': --reference-allele $functions.ref_allele.file $functions.ref_allele.column $functions.ref_allele.var_id $functions.ref_allele.skip #end if #if $functions.a2_allele.set == 'yes': --a2-allele $functions.a2_allele.file $functions.a2_allele.column $functions.a2_allele.var_id $functions.a2_allele.skip #end if #elif $functions.func == 'stats': $functions.freq $functions.hardy $functions.missing $functions.het #if $functions.sex.sex_stats: $functions.sex.sex_stats #if $functions.sex.mode: $functions.sex.mode.mode #if $functions.sex.mode.mode == 'ycount' $functions.sex.mode.female_max $functions.sex.mode.male_min $functions.sex.mode.female_max_obvs $functions.sex.mode.male_min_obvs #elif $functions.sex.mode.mode == 'y-only' $functions.sex.mode.female_max_obvs $functions.sex.mode.male_min_obvs #else: $functions.sex.mode.female_max $functions.sex.mode.male_min #end if #end if #end if #elif $functions.func == 'link': #if $functions.set_indep.choice == 'Yes': --indep-pairwise $functions.set_indep.window $functions.set_indep.step $functions.set_indep.r2 #end if ## #elif $functions.func == 'pair_compare': ## ## #elif $functions.func == 'dist_sim': ## #elif $functions.func == 'stratification': #if $functions.read_genome: --read-genome $functions.read_genome #end if #if $functions.cluster.cluster == 'Yes': --cluster #for $type in $functions.cluster.modifiers $type #end for #if $functions.cluster.mds.mds_scaling == 'Yes': --mds-plot $functions.cluster.mds.dimensions #for $type in $functions.cluster.mds.modifiers $type #end for #end if #end if
#elif $functions.func == 'association': #if $functions.assoc.assoc == 'Yes': --assoc #if $functions.assoc.perm.perm == 'perm': perm #elif $functions.assoc.perm.perm == 'mperm': mperm='$functions.assoc.perm.value' #end if $functions.assoc.genedrop $functions.assoc.perm_count $functions.assoc.fisher $functions.assoc.count #end if #if $functions.adjust.adjust == 'Yes': --adjust #for $type in $functions.adjust.tests: $type #end for #end if ## #if $functions.linear.linear == 'Yes': ## --linear ## #if $functions.linear.perm == 'perm': ## perm ## #elif $functions.linear.perm == 'mperm': ## mperm='$functions.linear.perm.value' ## #end if ## $functions.linear.genedrop ## $functions.linear.perm_count ## $functions.linear.dominance ## $functions.linear.hide_covar ## $functions.linear.sex_covar ## $functions.linear.interaction ## $functions.linear.beta ## $functions.linear.standard_beta ## $functions.linear.intercept ## #end if #if $functions.logistic.logistic == 'Yes': --logistic #if $functions.logistic.perm.perm == 'perm': perm #elif $functions.logistic.perm.perm == 'mperm': mperm='$functions.logistic.perm.value' #end if $functions.logistic.genedrop $functions.logistic.perm_count $functions.logistic.dominance $functions.logistic.hide_covar $functions.logistic.sex_covar $functions.logistic.interaction $functions.logistic.beta $functions.logistic.intercept #end if --lambda $functions.lambda #elif $functions.func == 'ibd': #if $functions.genome.output_genome: --genome #for $type in $functions.genome.modifiers $type #end for #if $functions.genome.min: --min $functions.genome.min #end if #if $functions.genome.max: --max $functions.genome.max #end if #if $functions.genome.ppc: --ppc-gap $functions.genome.ppc #end if #end if
#elif $functions.func == 'scoring': --score $functions.score_file $functions.variant_id_i $functions.allel_codes_j $functions.scores_k $functions.header $functions.sum ## #else: ## --rerun $functions.logfile ## #end if --memory \${GALAXY_MEMORY_MB:-8192} --make-bed --out plink_output/plink_output
#if $functions.func == 'association': #if $functions.logistic.logistic == 'Yes': && mkdir logistic_out && mv plink_output/plink_output.*.l* logistic_out && find ./logistic_out/. -type f -exec mv {} {}.txt ';' #end if #if $functions.adjust.adjust == 'Yes': && mkdir adjust_out && mv ./plink_output/*.adjuste* adjust_out && find ./adjust_out/. -type f -exec mv {} {}.txt ';' #end if #if $functions.assoc.assoc == 'Yes': && mkdir assoc_out && mv ./plink_output/*asso* assoc_out && find ./assoc_out/. -type f -exec mv {} {}.txt ';' #end if #end if && mkdir '$plink_out.extra_files_path' && cp plink_output/plink_output.bed '$plink_out.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.bed' && cp plink_output/plink_output.bim '$plink_out.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.bim' && cp plink_output/plink_output.fam '$plink_out.extra_files_path/RgeneticsData.fam' #if $functions.func == 'scoring': && awk -v OFS="\t" '{$1=$1; print}' plink_output/plink_output.profile > plink_output/plink_output.profile.tab #end if

param.name: pheno
param.label: Phenotype file
param.help: Read phenotype values from the 3rd column of the specified space- or tab-delimited file, instead of the .fam or .ped file.

param.name: all_pheno
param.label: Allow all phenotypes present in the phenotype file to be subject to the association tests you have requested

param.name: file
param.label: Keep file.
param.help: Accepts one or more space/tab-delimited text files with sample IDs, and removes all unlisted samples from the current analysis;

param.name: file
param.label: Keep-fam file
param.help: Accepts text files with family IDs in the first column, and keeps entire families.

param.name: file
param.label: Remove file
param.help: Accepts one or more space/tab-delimited text files with sample IDs, and removes all listed samples from the current analysis

param.name: file
param.label: Remove-fam file
param.help: Acceptz text files with family IDs in the first column, and removes entire families.

param.name: file
param.label: Extract
param.help: Accepts one or more text file(s) with variant IDs , and removes all unlisted variants from the current analysis

param.name: range
param.help: Input file is input in set range format.

param.name: file
param.label: Exclude
param.help: Accepts one or more text file(s) with variant IDs , and removes all listed variants from the current analysis

param.name: range
param.help: Input file is input in set range format.

param.name: chromosome
param.label: Chromosome(s)
param.help: Excludes all variants not on the listed chromosome(s). Can be listed as single chromsome, a hyphenated range, or comma separated list.

param.name: excluded_chromosome
param.label: Exclude Chromosome(s)
param.help: Excludes all variants on the listed chromosome(s). Can be listed as single chromsome, a hyphenated range, or comma separated list.

param.name: extra_chromosomes
param.label: Allow extra chromosomes
param.help: Allows specified extra chromosomes/scaffolds not normally listed. ex. chr1_gl000191_random.

param.name: autosome
param.label: Autosome/unplaced exclusion
param.option: Exclude all unplaced and non-autosomal variants
Excludes all unplaced and non-autosomal variants, but keep XY/PAR1/PAR2. Can be combined with exclude-chromosmes.

param.name: snps_exclusives
param.label: SNP exclusive
param.option: Return SNPs, excluding any other than {'A', 'C', 'G', 'T', 'a', 'c', 'g', 't', missing}

param.name: single_multi
param.label: Single or multiple variant-based range window?

param.name: type
param.label: Specify range for variants
param.option: Within a specific area (Must also specify a single chromosome in above input)

param.name: from
param.label: From
param.help: Variant ID. Excludes all variants on different chromosomes than the named variant, as well as those with smaller base-pair position values. If they are used together but the --from variant is after the --to variant, they are automatically swapped.

param.name: to
param.label: To
param.help: Variant ID. Excludes all variants on different chromosomes than the named variant, as well as those with larger base-pair position values. If they are used together but the --from variant is after the --to variant, they are automatically swapped.

param.name: snp
param.label: SNP variant id to include
param.help: Use this OR SNP variant to exclude

param.name: exclude_snp
param.label: SNP variant id to exclude
param.help: Use this OR SNP variant to include

param.name: window
param.label: Window
param.help: All variants with physical position no more than half the specified kb distance (decimal permitted) from the named variant are loaded as well

param.name: from_bp
param.label: from-bp
param.help: These flags let you use physical positions to specify a variant range to load. Must also have specified a chromosome in above settings.

param.name: to_bp
param.label: to-bp
param.help: These flags let you use physical positions to specify a variant range to load. Must also have specified a chromosome in above settings.

param.name: force_intersect
param.label: Force intersect
param.help: To reduce the potential for confusion, PLINK 2 normally errors out when multiple variant-inclusion filters (--extract[-intersect], --extract-col-cond, --from/--to, --from-bp/--to-bp, --snp, --snps) are specified, since it may not be obvious whether the intersection or union will be taken. --force-intersect allows the run to proceed; the set intersection will be taken.

param.name: snps
param.label: List of SNP variant ids to include

param.name: exclude_snps
param.label: List of SNP variant ids to exclude

param.name: thin
param.label: Thin
param.help: Removes variants at random by retaining each variant with probability p

param.name: thin_count
param.label: Thin Count
param.help: Removes variants at random until only n remain

param.name: bp_space
param.label: BP space
param.help: Excludes one variant from each pair closer than the given bp count

param.name: thin_indiv
param.label: Thin Individual
param.help: Removes samples at random by retaining each sample with probability p

param.name: thin_indiv_count
param.label: Thin Individual count
param.help: Removes samples at random until only n remain.

param.name: geno
param.label: Set Geno
param.help: filters out all variants with missing call rates exceeding the provided value (default 0.1) to be removed

param.name: mind
param.label: Set Mind
param.help: filters out all samples with missing call rates exceeding the provided value (default 0.1) to be removed

param.name: maf
param.label: Minimum allele frequency
param.help: Filters out all variants with allele frequency below the provided threshold

param.name: max_maf
param.label: Maximum allele frequency
param.help: Filters out all variants with allele frequency above the provided threshold

param.name: mac
param.label: Minimum allele count
param.help: Filters out all variants with allele counts below the provided threshold

param.name: max_mac
param.label: Maximum allele count
param.help: filters out all variants with allele counts above the provided threshold

param.name: hwe
param.help: Set Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium tests

param.name: hwe_val
param.label: Hardy-Weinberg Equilibrium
param.help: Filters out all variants which have Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium exact test p-value below the provided threshold. It is recommended setting a low threshold—serious genotyping errors often yield extreme p-values like 1e-501 which are detected by any reasonable configuration of this test, while genuine SNP-trait associations can be expected to deviate slightly from Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium (so it is dangerous to choose a threshold that filters out too many variants).

param.name: modifiers
param.label: Test modifiers
param.option: Apply the mid-p adjustment described in Graffelman J, Moreno V (2013) The mid p-value in exact tests for Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium
Don't ignore cases and missing phenotypes'

param.name: sex_select
param.label: Sex select
param.help: Filter by phenotypes, experiment, and founder state.
param.option: Do not specifically filter out based on sex or founders
Exclude all samples with at least one known parental ID
Only include samples with at least one known parental ID

param.name: no_sex_select
param.label: No sex settings
param.help: How to deal with ambiguous sex phenotypes
param.option: Change nothing with regards to ambiguous sex samples
Prevent samples with ambiguous sex frim having their phenotypes set to missing when analysis commands are run
Force phenotypes of ambiguous-sex samples to missing in output

param.name: nonfounders
param.label: Nonfouders
param.help: Include nonfounders in --freq[x] or --maf/--max-maf/--hwe calculations

param.name: recode
param.label: Recode
param.help: Create a new text fileset, after applying sample/variant filters and other operations

param.name: flip
param.label: Flip DNA strand for SNPs
param.help: Given a file containing a list of SNPs with A/C/G/T alleles, --flip swaps A↔T and C↔G.

param.name: template
param.label: Update Variant Info: Template String
param.help: Replaces missing IDs. The parameter taken by these flags is a special template string, with a @ where the chromosome code should go, and a # where the base-pair position belongs.

param.name: length
param.label: Max allele length
param.help: Length threshold to rename alleles. Recommended default is 23

param.name: input
param.help: By default, the new value is read from column 2 and the (old) variant ID from column 1, but you can adjust these positions with the second and third parameters.

param.name: skip
param.label: Skip
param.help: Either a nonnegative integer, in which case it indicates the number of lines to skip at the top of the file, or a single nonnumeric character, which causes each line with that leading character to be skipped.

param.name: input
param.help: By default, the new value is read from column 2 and the (old) variant ID from column 1, but you can adjust these positions with the second and third parameters.

param.name: skip
param.label: Skip
param.help: Either a nonnegative integer, in which case it indicates the number of lines to skip at the top of the file, or a single nonnumeric character, which causes each line with that leading character to be skipped.

param.name: set
param.label: Set REF alleles
param.help: These cannot be used with any other commands.

param.name: file
param.label: Set all alleles specified in the file to REF

param.name: skip
param.label: Skip
param.help: Either a nonnegative integer, in which case it indicates the number of lines to skip at the top of the file, or a single nonnumeric character, which causes each line with that leading character to be skipped.

param.name: set
param.label: Set a2 alleles
param.help: These cannot be used with any other commands.

param.name: file
param.label: Set all alleles specified in the file to first ALT allele

param.name: skip
param.label: Skip
param.help: Either a nonnegative integer, in which case it indicates the number of lines to skip at the top of the file, or a single nonnumeric character, which causes each line with that leading character to be skipped.

param.name: hardy
param.label: Return Hardy-Weinberg statistics file
param.help: Writes out writes autosomal Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium exact test statistics

param.name: missing
param.label: Missing Data
param.help: produces sample-based and variant-based missing data reports

param.name: het
param.label: Inbreeding
param.help: Compute observed and expected homozygous/heterozygous genotype counts for each sample, and reports method-of-moments F coefficient estimates

param.name: sex_stats
param.label: Sex imputation
param.option: Compare sex assignments in input dataset with those imputed from X chromosome inbreeding coefficients
Changes sex assignments to the imputed values. Cannot be set with any other flags.

param.name: choice
param.label: Variant pruning
param.help: Since two-variant r2 only makes sense for biallelic variants, these collapse multiallelic variants down to most common allele vs. the rest.

param.name: window
param.label: Window size in bp
param.help: Window size

param.name: cluster
param.help: Use IBS values calculated via --genome to perform complete linkage clustering

param.name: modifiers
param.label: Cluster flag modifiers
param.option: Prevent two all-case or two all-control clusters from being merged.

By default, the distance between two clusters is defined as the maximum pairwise distance between a member of the first cluster and a member of the second cluster. Cause average pairwise distance to be used instead.
Cause clustering to be based on identity-by-missingness

param.name: mds_scaling
param.help: Return a Haploview-friendly multidimensional scaling report

param.name: modifiers
param.label: mds-plot flag modifiers
param.option: Perform mds scaling on an inter-cluster distance matrix
Request faster eigendocomposition-based algorithm, yielding slightly different results
Write out top eigenvalues to separate file

param.name: perm
param.help: Request an adaptive or max(T) permutation test on the additive effect.
param.option: Perform a max(T) permutation test with specified number of replications

param.name: genedrop
param.label: genedrop
param.help: Cause offspring genotypes to be regenerated via gene-dropping in the permutation test.

param.name: perm_count
param.label: Perm-count
param.help: Cause the permutation test report to include permutation counts instead of frequencies.

param.name: fisher
param.label: Fisher tests
param.option: User Fisher's exact test with Lancaster's mid-p adjustment

param.name: count
param.label: Counts
param.help: Report allele counts instead of frequencies

param.name: adjust
param.label: Report basic multiple testing corrections for the raw p-values

param.name: tests
param.label: Testing modifiers
param.option: Use genomic-controlled p-values in the formulas
Replace the p-values in the .adjusted file with their negative base 10 logarithms.
Add a quantile column to simplify QQ plotting.

param.name: logistic
param.label: Perform logistic regression and return report

param.name: perm
param.help: Request an adaptive or max(T) permutation test on the additive effect.
param.option: Perform a max(T) permutation test with specified number of replications

param.name: genedrop
param.label: genedrop
param.help: Cause offspring genotypes to be regenerated via gene-dropping in the permutation test.

param.name: perm_count

param.help: Cause the permutation test report to include permutation counts instead of frequencies.

param.name: dominance
param.label: Set dominance model
param.option: Add an additive effect/dominance deviation 2df joint test (with two genotype-dependent variables in the regression, one with 0/1/2 coding and the second with 0/1/0
Add an additive effect/dominance deviation 2df joint test (with two genotype-dependent variables in the regression, one with 0/0/1 coding and the second with 0/1/0
Assume full dominance in A1 allele
Assume full recessiveness in A1 allele
Request a regression only on the phenotype and the covariates, without reference to genomic data

param.name: hide_covar
param.label: Hide covar
param.help: Remove covariate-specific lines from the main report

param.name: sex_covar
param.label: Sex as a covariate
param.option: By default, when at least one male and one female is present, sex (male = 1, female = 0) is automatically added as a covariate on X chromosome SNPs, and nowhere else. The 'sex' modifier causes it to be added everywhere.

By default, when at least one male and one female is present, sex (male = 1, female = 0) is automatically added as a covariate on X chromosome SNPs, and nowhere else. The 'no-x-sex' modifier causes it to be excluded everywhere

param.name: interaction
param.label: Interaction
param.help: Add genotype x covariate interactions to the model.

param.name: score_file
param.label: Scoring system which should be applied to all samples

param.name: header
param.label: Is a header line present in the scores file?

param.name: sum
param.label: How to combine the valid per-variant scores?
param.help: Average is the default, but it can be changed to sum.
param.option: Final scores are averages of the valid per-variant scores
Report sums (sum; can not be used with 'no-mean-imputation'; is automatically on with dosage data)

param.name: output_genome
param.help: Perform and return results of IBS/IBD computation

param.name: min

param.help: Minimum PI_HAT value

param.name: max
param.label: max
param.help: Maximum PI_HAT value

param.name: ppc

param.name: modifiers

param.option: Remove pairs of samples with different FIDs
Add IBS , HOMHOM and HETHET fields to output
Turn off clipping due to IBD estimator
If PI_HAT2 greater than P(IBD=2), adjusts the final estimates to P(IBD=0) := (1-p2), P(IBD=1) := 2p(1-p), and P(IBD=2) := p2, where p is the current PI_HAT

data.label: ${tool.name}: Cluster 3

tool.help:
PLINK is a free, open-source whole genome association analysis toolset, designed to perform a range of basic, large-scale analyses in a computationally efficient manner.
For detailed usage notes, visit http://www.cog-genomics.org/plink/2.0/
